result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Lee Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in warrant.

Sentencing Hearing - January 25, 2016

Defendant Jerome Lee Williams in court with attorney Daniel P Repka.  Defendant Jerome Lee Williams in custody.  Daniel J Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 143pm 

14CF98 
Ct 1: I/S 18.5 yrs- 13.5 IC, 5 ES, prob 7.5 yrs, bank 1 yr jail to be used by agent if nec.  120 hrs CS. 
Cts 3 & 4:  2 yrs on each count- consec to each other but concurrent to MN time, 366 days credit. Elig for CIP and SAP. fine & cost on each count. DNA sample. 

14CF133 
Ct 1: 7 yrs- 4 yrs IC, 3 ES- consecutive to Ct 1 in 14CF98 & concurrent to Cts 3 & 4 in 14CF98, $382.10 RSH + 10% surcharge of $38.21 = $420.31 can be paid out of prison wages. Elig for CIP and SAP. $290.60 fine/cost. DNA sample.

CASES: 14CF341, 14CF98, 14CF133 Defendant Jerome Lee Williams in court with attorney Daniel P. Repka.  Defendant Jerome Lee Williams in custody.
